comment: Calculated Value based on weighted average from 3 mines. For wastewater treatment. The chemicals used for the wastewater treatment are based on the two smaller mines which has different inputs for water treatment.

The exchange has been updated from "ammonium nitrate, as N" into "ammonium nitrate" and therefore its amount has been scaled (multiplied) from 245.315 kg by 2.8573 kg of "ammonium nitrate" per kg of "ammonium nitrate, as N". Original comment of the exchange is: Calculated value. See parameters exchanges properties for details.

Calculated Value based on weighted average from 3 mines. It is assume that the given amount represented the complecte explosive, i.e. 94% ammonium nitrate and 6% petrol.
Assumption : diesel low sulfur.

Calculated Value. The refining of the doré bars to produce gold and silver, occuring in Ontario (Canada), has been added to this dataset in order to comply with the boundaries of the GLO dataset (vertical aggregation). Elctricity used has been modelled in a very simplified way. See exchange properties for details.
Electricity consumption should be allocated on the basis of the amount used for gold and silver.
Calculated Value based on weighted average from 3 mines.

Calculated Value based on weighted average from 1 mine (information was not available for the 2 other mines).
Raw data gives the amount of anti-freeze. It is assume that 60% ethylene glycol solution (% by volume), as its freezing point is -55 C (neglect water as it is marginal compared to the global amount of water consumed on site).

input_name: market for mine infrastructure, gold and silver
comment:
Extrapolation based on gold-silver mine operation with refinery, GLO dataset. 
The mine infrastructure, gold and silver dataset, in which the modelled mines are open pit, is not representative of the Quebec situation where two of the three modelled mine are underground.  
A mine infrastrucuture, gold and silver, Québec will eventually be created in order to reflect the Québec specificity.

input_name: market for sulfidic tailings, from gold mine operation
comment:
Calculated Value based on weighted average from 3 mines.
20% is sent underground to be used as backfill (excluded from the amount); sulfidic tailing is managed on site. 
The sulfidic tailings, off-site dataset is used as a proxy, composition of leachage to groundwater may not fully correspond.
